comment.author: 86916510@N00
comment._content:
A composite full-rigged ship built of teak and iron in 1866. She was the largest composite sailing ship ever built.

1866 - Launched at the shipyard of A. Hall, Aberdeen, for Lowther, Maxton & Co., London. Employed in the Australian passenger & cargo trade.

1892 - Sold to the New South Wales Government for £ 15.000 and turned into a reformatory ship moored off Cockatoo Island in Sydney harbour. 

1911 - Sold to the Commonwealth Government for £ 15.000 and was renamed HMAS Tingara. Converted into a training ship for boys entering the Australian Navy at a cost of £ 7000. 

1927 - Sold and moored in Berry's Bay, Sydney. 

1941 - Broken up at Sydney.
